chunks.text: In this video, I'll tell you about ID and classes.

chunks.title: Id & Classes in HTML
chunks.text: The concept of ID and classes is very confusing.

chunks.title: Id & Classes in HTML
chunks.text: In fact, when I was learning HTML in my early days, I was very confused about ID and classes.

chunks.title: Id & Classes in HTML
chunks.text: ID means unique identifier.

chunks.title: Id & Classes in HTML
chunks.text: If you give an ID to an element, then you won't give that ID to another element.

chunks.title: Id & Classes in HTML
chunks.text: But class means that if you want to give multiple elements, then you'll give it multiple classes.

chunks.title: Id & Classes in HTML
chunks.text: For example, you can give a class named red to a div and a form.

chunks.title: Id & Classes in HTML
chunks.text: Similarly, you can give a class named BG red to an article tag and a header tag.

ID means unique identifier. If you give an ID to an element, then you won't give that ID to another element. But class means that if you want to give multiple elements, then you'll give it multiple classes. For example, you can give a class named red to a div and a form.
